game_description: THE WORLD OF ALTAIR Set on the floating island of Vastus Isle, once a magic workshop now in ruins and exploited to run AI experiments. Take on battles to push back the army of LAWS (Lethal Autonomous Weapons Systems) that are roaming around and help Stella, the humanoid AI left in charge of ALTAIR, to maintain peace. BATTLE SYSTEM Move from map to map while enjoying the feeling of transcendent sword fighting. Take advantage of your surroundings by climbing and gliding to easily take on enemies. Experience a wide range of attacks only possible in the VR world, like Shockwaves and Surge Mode. USER-FRIENDLY UI A simplified and intuitive UI was developed to increase the sense of VR and not interrupt the game flow. The Tablet will be your main hub to change equipment, check your status and more. CO-OP MULTIPLAYER Team up with other 3 players from around the world and take on enemies together. The game supports crossplay between Quest 2 and PCVR and features a native voice chat system.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), Chinese (Hong Kong), Chinese (Taiwan), French (Canada), French (France), Japanese, Korean, Spanish (Mexico)
review_1: Listen this game is great but the AI is the worst I've ever seen all they do is back up and shoot projectiles. All day long and when you try to get closer they just Teleport away, then once they FINALLY attack you just get one hitted. Now besides the infinite amount of backing up. The projectiles... yea honestly they just suck. The only way to counter them is with a shield and for the wide majority of players, including me, we use two handed weapons so a shield is basically obsolete a cool counter would be like powers that help defend against the projectiles like a blocking mechanism like the shield. But other than the AI the games great the people are nice the sword fighting is good and I like the leveling up system. So yeah that's basically it
review_2: This game is amazing to play but if I could say something tho the rewards you receive at the end of each quest could be better and could do with some more add ons. They got to upgrade it with a lounge or meeting place with an endless floor quest where you have to get as far as possible, I mean that would top the game to elite but as it is now it's truly a well made game
review_3: i wish i could get into this game seeing how they made swords of gargantua but honestly swords of gargantua was much more fun to play, this game just doesnt feel good or fluent i didnt out much time into it since i wasnt enjoying it and i put too much time into it to get a refund, the level designs are alright i dont like having to run all over the map to kill a few enemies for more to spawn far away makes grinding annoying, every time i try to counter an enemy i notice that sometimes their blade goes through my greatsword and hits me, i wouldnt mind grinding a million coins for the cooler looking weapons but like i said running around the map for a few coins isnt exactly encouraging for grinding, the final boss i keep killing is so much easier than gargantua which is nice but also kinda disappointing since its too easy to kill, thats my honest review of the game i'll come back later once i see some changes but for now game is just meh
